Element.name: SuccessPortDefinition
Element.Description:
A Success Port Definition is the exit point of an Action Definition that causes a Success Event to be thrown on the referencing Actions.

All parameters added to the definition are made available on the referencing Success Event and can be bound to external elements.

PropertyCategory.name: General
PropertyCategory.Property: If checked, the Success Port Definition is reached automatically from elements of the Action Definition that execute successfully but have no applicable outgoing Success Flows modeled.
If checked, the port definition is the default success port definition of the Action Definition.
The default output parameter dedicated to the feedback message.

PropertyCategory.name: Appearance
PropertyCategory.Property: A distinctive icon displayed in the diagram and in the outline.
If checked, all parts belonging to this port definition will be displayed.
